channel.title: [PI] Webclient NEED HELP
channel.description:
Hi,
I currently have a webclient up where a mate of mine helped me with and he gave me this link:
http://webclientjars.webs.com/Jars/%5BPI%5Dloader.jar
Once I had put that into a code and made it into a BBCode on my forum it looked like this:
[code=java]<applet name=client width=765 height=503 archive='http://webclientjars.webs.com/Jars/%5BPI%5Dloader.jar' code='client.class'> <PARAM name='java_arguments' value='-Xmx700m'> <PARAM name='server_name' value='UniqueScape'> <PARAM name='detail' value='low'> <PARAM name='ip' value='beastmode2.no-ip.org'> <PARAM name='port' value='43594'> <PARAM name='background_image' value='http://i53.tinypic.com/fei4oy.jpg'> <PARAM name='headicons' value=''> </applet> [/code]
BUT now I've made some changes in my client that I'd like to see happening in the WebClient so I figured I'd have to change the earlier download link with a new link that downloads the actual client that I'm working with now.. Make sense right?
SO I've jarred my client using this guide: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CiDQ7igB6fk (i've seen a few others I think its right) and I now have a file Client with a type as "executable jar file" which I think is the file I'm needing.
BUT NOW how do I get that file into a automatic download link that I can put in the code from above ^ so it'll swap clients.
If anyone knows this it'd be a huge help and relieve and I'll rep you :).
Thank you very much.

item.title: [PI] Webclient NEED HELP
item.dc:creator: @baddy351 baddy351
item.description:
@baddy351 wrote:

This belongs here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/board,138.0.html

item.title: [PI] Webclient NEED HELP
item.dc:creator: @UniqueTrys UniqueTrys
item.description:
@UniqueTrys wrote:

Hi,

I currently have a webclient up where a mate of mine helped me with and he gave me this link:

http://webclientjars.webs.com/Jars/[PI]loader.jar

Once I had put that into a code and made it into a BBCode on my forum it looked like this:

[code=java]

[/code]

BUT now I’ve made some changes in my client that I’d like to see happening in the WebClient so I figured I’d have to change the earlier download link with a new link that downloads the actual client that I’m working with now… Make sense right?

SO I’ve jarred my client using this guide: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CiDQ7igB6fk (i’ve seen a few others I think its right) and I now have a file Client with a type as “executable jar file” which I think is the file I’m needing.

BUT NOW how do I get that file into a automatic download link that I can put in the code from above ^ so it’ll swap clients.

If anyone knows this it’d be a huge help and relieve and I’ll rep you :).

Thank you very much.

Read full topic
